plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: A deciduous flowering cherry tree revered for its spectacular, fleeting clusters of fragrant pink to white blossoms that herald spring in temperate regions, especially in Japan and parts of the U.S.
plants.location: Japan, United States (Washington D.C., Pacific Northwest)
plants.funFact: The bloom time of cherry blossoms is famously short, often just a week or two, marking the cultural phenomenon of 'Hanami' or flower viewing in Japan.

plants.name: Erythronium americanum
plants.description: A native woodland wildflower with mottled, trout-like leaves and bright yellow nodding flowers, blooming early spring in deciduous forests in eastern North America.
plants.funFact: Trout lilies reproduce both by seed and through underground bulbs, allowing them to form extensive colonies over time.

plants.name: Magnolia liliiflora
plants.description: A Chinese native deciduous magnolia with large, tulip-shaped magenta to purple flowers appearing early spring before the leaves fully unfurl.
plants.location: China, cultivated worldwide in temperate gardens
plants.funFact: Magnolias are among the oldest flowering plant lineages, existing for over 95 million years.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: An Australian native tree with cylindrical flower spikes made up of hundreds of tiny yellow flowers, blooming from late summer to winter but also sporadically in autumn and spring depending on the region.
plants.bloomingSeason: Varies by region; often including April
plants.funFact: Banksia flowers are an important nectar source for birds like honeyeaters in Australian ecosystems.
